pullRequest.body:
When working with generators and presentations, we rely on the `MvPolynomial` API, but since the type of variables is bundled in `Generators R S`, many lemmas don't apply with `rw` or `simp`, because they can't see through the definition of `vars` in constructions such as `Generators.comp` and `Generators.localizationAway`.

A possible approach is to make all of these constructions `abbrev`s, but this causes `simp` to also unfold `val` which is not always desirable. More generally, it is then harder to predict how instance search and `simp` behave. This approach is tried in #21050, but causes many regressions.

This approach is less invasive, as it uses `unif_hint` to unify the `vars` (and `rels`) fields of constructions with the correct type.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [7e27f5e85a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21099/commits/7e27f5e85a95714d6fdcad158ecfe06d697920bf)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CotangentSpace.compEquiv_tmul_D_X_inl`
`+ CotangentSpace.compEquiv_tmul_D_X_inr`
`+ Hom.toExtensionHom_toAlgHom_apply`
`+ ofComp_toAlgHom_rename`
`+ smul_δAux_elim`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (4.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1413|-4|erw|

Current commit [7e27f5e85a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/7e27f5e85a95714d6fdcad158ecfe06d697920bf)
Reference commit [efeadfb186](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/efeadfb18697dff701318aa598fc7cd36099920a)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/bc6f9f01-f323-4c1d-b759-b94a7bc83890) for commit 1e6f88bb7a28196a5419fa9ce94feb1118926e88.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/077301f4-af06-49d4-9645-cf85fb67e5cc) for commit 3019c699746dec31750f717dbf58fd0bc7280cfd.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/fbb76a5c-e017-4dd4-8f85-395cdbbfcc0b/to/077301f4-af06-49d4-9645-cf85fb67e5cc) against commit efeadfb18697dff701318aa598fc7cd36099920a:
```diff
  Benchmark                                   Metric         Change
  =================================================================
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Kaehler.JacobiZariski   instructions    35.6%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+260.857⬝10⁹|(+0.17%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Kaehler.JacobiZariski`|+258.633⬝10⁹|(+35.55%)|
|`Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Presentation.Differentials`|+4.708⬝10⁹|(+7.49%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Generators`|+2.810⬝10⁹|(+3.24%)|
|`Mathlib.RingTheory.Etale.Kaehler`|-4.215⬝10⁹|(-1.36%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12977748936)
Can you open a topic on Zulip? I'd like to hear from people who actually know what `unif_hint` does under the hood.

> We need an improvement performance wise here before I am comfortable merging this

I agree, do you have an idea on how to improve the situation in the `JacobiZariski` file?

I took a brief look at this file on Friday. The main thing I discovered is that specializing universe levels could result in dramatic speed ups. At a loss of polymorphicity. 

It seems the universe level inside the structure is difficult for Lean to manage. 

If I have time today, I'll see if I can figure anything more out

> I took a brief look at this file on Friday. The main thing I discovered is that specializing universe levels could result in dramatic speed ups. At a loss of polymorphicity.
> 
> It seems the universe level inside the structure is difficult for Lean to manage.
> 
> If I have time today, I'll see if I can figure anything more out

Thanks! I'll do some more cleaning ups of proofs in the meantime, this might also help.
We need an improvement performance wise here before I am comfortable merging this
We need an improvement performance wise here before I am comfortable merging this
This is the worst regression.
And this is annoying.
Can you put the PR message (or something similar) in a library note and just link to that in these `unif_hints`?

pullRequest.title: chore(RingTheory/Generators): use unification hints for variables and relations
